author: David Faber
title: CBS, Viacom had agreed on price for deal before lawsuit, sources say
text:
CBS and Viacom had reached a deal in price for a merger before the ongoing disagreement over leadership of the combined company ripped the two apart, according to sources familiar with the situation.
The agreed upon price was a ratio of 0.6135 CBS shares for every Viacom class B share.
CBS sued Shari Redstone's National Amusements , the controlling shareholder of both companies, on Monday to block her from to interfering at a special board meeting where the merger would be considered.
Redstone could counter sue CBS directors for a breach of loyalty, the sources said. David Faber “Squawk on the Street” Co-Anchor Related Securities
